conclusion: Analyze the displacement-time graph to determine moments when speed is 5 m/s.
The graph shows displacement x as a function of time t.
The slope of the tangent represents the instantaneous velocity.
Positive slope indicates positive velocity; negative slope indicates negative velocity.
The problem provides an illustration with tangent lines at specific points.
Tangent lines help find points where speed is 5 m/s.
Find points where the absolute value of the slope is 5.
There are two points where the slope of the tangent line has an absolute value of 5.
Conclude there are two moments within 0 to 4 seconds where speed is 5 m/s.
